{{cpp/memory/enable_shared_from_this/title|enable_shared_from_this}}
{{cpp/memory/enable_shared_from_this/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++11| 
constexpr enable_shared_from_this() noexcept;
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++11|
enable_shared_from_this( const enable_shared_from_this&amp; other ) noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Constructs a new {{tt|enable_shared_from_this}} object. {{rlpsi|/#weak_this}} is [[cpp/language/value initialization|value-initialized]].

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|other|an {{tt|enable_shared_from_this}} to copy}}
{{par end}}

===Notes===
There is no move constructor: moving from an object derived from {{tt|enable_shared_from_this}} does not transfer its shared identity.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;memory&gt;

struct Foo : public std::enable_shared_from_this&lt;Foo&gt;
{
    Foo() {} // implicitly calls enable_shared_from_this constructor
    std::shared_ptr&lt;Foo&gt; getFoo() { return shared_from_this(); }
};

int main()
{
    std::shared_ptr&lt;Foo&gt; pf1(new Foo);
    auto pf2 = pf1-&gt;getFoo(); // shares ownership of object with pf1
}
|output=
}}
